# MTLComputePassSampleBufferAttachmentDescriptor

**Class**

A configuration that instructs the GPU where to store counter data from the beginning and end of a compute pass.

## Declaration

```swift
class MTLComputePassSampleBufferAttachmentDescriptor
```

## Overview

For more context about configuring sample buffer attachments for compute passes, see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/sampling-gpu-data-into-counter-sample-buffers]. That article is one of a series in [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/gpu-counters-and-counter-sample-buffers] about sampling Metal hardware counters for performance measurement.

## Configuring the sample buffer attachment

- **sampleBuffer**: A specialized memory buffer that the GPU uses to store its counter data during a compute pass.
- **startOfEncoderSampleIndex**: An index within a counter sample buffer that tells the GPU where to store counter data from the start of a compute pass.
- **endOfEncoderSampleIndex**: An index within a counter sample buffer that tells the GPU where to store counter data from the end of a compute pass.

## Configuring a compute pass

- **MTLComputePassDescriptor**: A description of how to dispatch execution of pass commands and GPU performance sampling.
- **MTLDispatchType**: The type of dispatch method to use when calling encoded functions.
- **MTLDispatchThreadgroupsIndirectArguments**: The data layout required for arguments needed to specify the size of threadgroups.
- **MTLComputePassSampleBufferAttachmentDescriptorArray**: A container that stores an array of sample buffer attachments for a compute pass.
